Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Respecting the Control of Narcotics

Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Narcotic Control Regulations.

Subsection.Text: In these Regulations,

Definition.Text: Act means the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act; (Loi)
advertisement means any representation by any means whatever for the purpose of promoting directly or indirectly the sale or disposal of a narcotic; (annonce)
cannabis means the substance set out in item 17 of the schedule; (chanvre indien)

cannabis medical document has the meaning assigned by the definition medical document in subsection 1(1) of the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations; (document médical concernant le chanvre indien)
cannabis oil has the same meaning as in subsection 1(1) of the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations; (huile de chanvre indien)

common-law partner, in relation to an individual, means a person who is cohabiting with the individual in a conjugal relationship, having so cohabited for a period of at least one year; (conjoint de fait)

competent authority means a public authority of a foreign country that is authorized under the laws of the country to approve the importation or exportation of narcotics into or from the country; (autorité compétente)
designated criminal offence means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving the financing of terrorism against any of sections 83.02 to 83.04 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving fraud against any of sections 380 to 382 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the offence of laundering proceeds of crime against section 462.31 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving a criminal organization against any of sections 467.11 to 467.13 of the Criminal Code; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a conspiracy or an attempt to commit, being an accessory after the fact in relation to, or any counselling in relation to, an offence referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (d); (infraction désignée en matière criminelle)

Definition.Text: designated drug offence means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an offence against section 39, 44.2, 44.3, 48, 50.2 or 50.3 of the Food and Drugs Act, as those provisions read immediately before May 14, 1997,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an offence against section 4, 5, 6, 19.1 or 19.2 of the Narcotic Control Act, as those provisions read immediately before May 14, 1997,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an offence under Part I of the Act, except subsection 4(1), or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a conspiracy or an attempt to commit, being an accessory after the fact in relation to, or any counselling in relation to, an offence referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (c); (infraction désignée en matière de drogue)

Definition.Text: diacetylmorphine (heroin) includes the salts of diacetylmorphine; (diacétylmorphine (héroïne))
dried marihuana has the same meaning as in subsection 1(1) of the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations; (marihuana séchée)

former Marihuana for Medical Purposes Regulations means the regulations made by Order in Council P.C. 2013-645 of June 6, 2013 and registered as SOR/2013-119; (ancien Règlement sur la marihuana à des fins médicales)

former Marihuana Medical Access Regulations means the regulations made by Order in Council P.C. 2001-1146 of June 14, 2001 and registered as SOR/2001-227; (ancien Règlement sur l’accès à la marihuana à des fins médicales).
fresh marihuana has the same meaning as in subsection 1(1) of the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations; (marihuana fraîche)
health care practitioner has, except in section 59, the same meaning as in subsection 1(1) of the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations; (praticien de la santé)
hospital means a facility

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is licensed, approved or designated by a province in accordance with the laws of the province to provide care or treatment to persons or animals suffering from any form of disease or illness, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is owned or operated by the Government of Canada or the government of a province and that provides health services; (hôpital)

Definition.Text: immediate container means the container that is in direct contact with the narcotic; (contenant immédiat)

international obligation means an obligation in respect of a narcotic set out in a convention, treaty or other multilateral or bilateral instrument that Canada has ratified or to which Canada adheres; (obligation internationale)
licensed dealer means the holder of a licence issued under section 9.2; (distributeur autorisé)
licensed producer has the same meaning as in subsection 1(1) of the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations; (producteur autorisé)
marihuana means the substance referred to as “Cannabis (marihuana)” in subitem 17(2) of the schedule; (marihuana)
methadone includes the salts of methadone; (méthadone)
midwife has the same meaning as in section 1 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations; (sage-femme)
narcotic means, subject to subsection (2),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any substance set out in the schedule or anything that contains the substance, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a midwife, nurse practitioner or podiatrist, any substance set out in the schedule, or anything that contains the substance, that the midwife, nurse practitioner or podiatrist may prescribe, possess or conduct an activity with, in accordance with sections 3 and 4 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations; (stupéfiant)

Definition.Text: nurse practitioner has the same meaning as in section 1 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations; (infirmier praticien)
permit means a permit issued under section 10; (permis)
pharmacist means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is registered or otherwise entitled under the laws of a province to practise pharmacy and to operate a pharmacy or dispensary and who

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is practising pharmacy in that province, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is operating a pharmacy or dispensary in that province, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of subsection 2(2), sections 3, 31 to 39, subsections 44(1), 45(1) and (2), section 46 and subsections 65(3) to (4), a person who is registered or otherwise entitled under the laws of a province to practise pharmacy and who is practising pharmacy in that province; (pharmacien)

Definition.Text: podiatrist has the same meaning as in section 1 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations; (podiatre)
prescription means, in respect of a narcotic, an authorization given by a practitioner that a stated amount of the narcotic be dispensed for the person named in the prescription; (ordonnance)

proper name, with reference to a narcotic, means the name internationally recognized for the narcotic or the name assigned to the narcotic in the latest edition of any generally recognized pharmacopoeia or compendium of drugs; (nom propre)

qualified person in charge means the individual with the qualifications specified in subsection 8.3(2) who is responsible for supervising the activities carried out by a licensed dealer under their licence at the premises specified in the licence; (personne qualifiée responsable)

Security Directive means the Directive on Physical Security Requirements for Controlled Substances (Security Requirements for Licensed Dealers for the Storage of Controlled Substances) published by the Department, as amended from time to time; (Directive en matière de sécurité)
test kit means an apparatus

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that contains reagent systems or buffering agents or both,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is used in the course of a chemical or analytical procedure for medical, laboratory, industrial, educational or research purposes, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the contents of which are not intended for administration to humans; (nécessaire d’essai)

Definition.Text: transfer means, except in subsection 45(3), to transfer, whether directly or indirectly, without consideration; (transférer)
verbal order means an order given orally; (commande verbale)
verbal prescription narcotic means medication that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: contains in addition to a narcotic two or more medicinal ingredients other than a narcotic in a recognized therapeutic dose,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is not intended for parenteral administration, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: does not contain diacetylmorphine (heroin), hydrocodone, methadone, oxycodone or pentazocine. (stupéfiant d’ordonnance verbale)

Subsection.Text: Despite subitem 2(2) of the schedule, the following are not narcotics for the purposes of these Regulations:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drug in dosage form, as defined in subsection C.01.005(3) of the Food and Drug Regulations, that contains cocaine (benzoylmethylecgonine) or any of its salts unless the drug has a drug identification number assigned to it under Division 1 of Part C of those Regulations, is authorized for sale under Division 5 of Part C of those Regulations or has been compounded by a pharmacist in accordance with or in anticipation of an authorization from a practitioner that a stated amount of the drug be dispensed for a person who is or will be named in the authorization; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cocaine (benzoylmethylecgonine) or any of its salts, or any drug that is not in dosage form that contains such a substance, unless the cocaine, salt or drug is to be compounded by a pharmacist in accordance with or in anticipation of an authorization from a practitioner that a stated amount of the drug be dispensed for a person who is or will be named in the authorization.

Subsection.Text: A person is authorized to have a narcotic in his or her possession where the person has obtained the narcotic under these Regulations, in the course of activities performed in connection with the enforcement or administration of an Act or regulation, or from a person who is exempt under section 56 of the Act from the application of subsection 5(1) of the Act with respect to that narcotic, and the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: requires the narcotic for his business or profession and is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a licensed dealer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a pharmacist, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a practitioner who is registered and entitled to practise in the province in which he has such possession;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is a practitioner who is registered and entitled to practise in a province other than the province in which he has such possession and such possession is for emergency medical purposes only;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is a hospital employee or a practitioner in a hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has obtained the narcotic for his or her own use

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: from a practitioner,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: pursuant to a prescription that is not issued or obtained in contravention of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: from a pharmacist pursuant to section 36, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: pursuant to a cannabis medical document that is not provided or obtained in contravention of the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: is a practitioner of medicine who received the narcotic pursuant to subsection 68(3) or (5) and his possession is for a purpose referred to in subsection 68(4) or (6);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: is an agent or mandatary of a practitioner of medicine who received the narcotic pursuant to section 68(3) and his possession is for the purpose of complying with subsection 68(5);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: is employed as an inspector, a member of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, a police constable, peace officer or member of the technical or scientific staff of any department of the Government of Canada or of a province or university and such possession is for the purposes of and in connection with such employment;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: is a person other than a person referred to in paragraph (e) or (f), is exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to the possession of that narcotic and whose possession is for a purpose set out in the exemption; or

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: is a person referred to in paragraph 68(4)(b).

Subsection.Text: A person is authorized to have a narcotic in his possession where the person is acting as the agent or mandatary for any person referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) to (e), (h) or (i).
A person is authorized to have a narcotic in his possession where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person is acting as the agent or mandatary for a person he has reasonable grounds to believe is a person referred to in paragraph (1)(g); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the possession of the narcotic is for the purpose of assisting that person in the enforcement or administration of an Act or regulation.

Section.Text: Any person may sell, possess or otherwise deal in a test kit that contains a narcotic if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a registration number has been issued for the test kit pursuant to section 6;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit bears, on its external surface,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the manufacturer’s name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the trade name or trade mark, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration number issued therefor pursuant to section 6;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit is sold, possessed or otherwise dealt in for the purpose of medical, laboratory, industrial, educational or research use; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the registration number has not been cancelled pursuant to section 7.

Section.Text: The manufacturer of a test kit that contains a narcotic may apply for a registration number by submitting to the Minister an application containing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: particulars of the design and construction of the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the narcotic and other substances, if any, contained in the test kit, including the qualitative and quantitative composition of each component;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the proposed use of the test kit; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any further information and material that the Minister may require to determine whether the test kit is one for which a registration number may be issued.

Section.Text: Where, on application under section 5, the Minister is satisfied that the test kit to which the application applies will only be used for medical, laboratory, industrial, educational or research use and that it

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: contains a narcotic and one or more adulterating or denaturing agents in such a manner, combination, quantity, proportion or concentration that the preparation or mixture has no significant drug abuse potential, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contains such small quantities or concentrations of any narcotic substance as to have no significant drug abuse potential,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: the Minister may issue a registration number for the test kit, which shall be a number preceded by the letters “TK”.

Section.Text: The Minister may cancel the registration number for a test kit if the test kit is removed from the market by the manufacturer or if, in the Minister’s opinion,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is necessary to cancel the registration number in the interest of public health; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit for which the registration number is issued is used or is likely to be used for any purpose other than medical, laboratory, industrial, educational or research use.

Subsection.Text: Subject to these Regulations and the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations, no person except a licensed dealer shall produce, make, assemble, import, export, sell, provide, transport, send or deliver a narcotic.
No licensed dealer shall import or export a narcotic without a permit.
No licensed dealer shall cultivate, propagate or harvest marihuana other than for scientific purposes.
No licensed dealer shall cultivate, propagate or harvest opium poppy other than for scientific purposes.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer is authorized to have a narcotic in their possession for the purpose of exporting the narcotic from Canada if they have obtained the narcotic in accordance with these Regulations or the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations.
To be eligible for a dealer’s licence, a person must be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who ordinarily resides in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a corporation that has its head office in Canada or operates a branch office in Canada; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of a position that includes responsibility for narcotics on behalf of a department of the Government of Canada or of a government of a province, a police force, a hospital or a university in Canada.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall designate one qualified person in charge, who may be the licensed dealer if the licensed dealer is an individual, who must work at the premises specified in the licence, have responsibility for supervising activities with respect to narcotics specified in the licence and for ensuring, on behalf of the licensed dealer, that those activities comply with these Regulations and the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may designate an alternate qualified person in charge who must work at the premises specified in the licence and have authority to replace the qualified person in charge when that person is absent.

Subsection.Text: The qualified person in charge and, if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be familiar with the provisions of the Act and the regulations under it that apply to the licence of the licensed dealer who designated them and have knowledge of chemistry and pharmacology and experience in those fields to properly carry out their duties;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall either

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be a pharmacist or a practitioner of medicine, dentistry or veterinary medicine, registered with a provincial professional licensing authority, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: possess a degree in an applicable science — such as pharmacy, medicine, dentistry, veterinary medicine, pharmacology, organic chemistry or chemical engineering — that is awarded by a Canadian university or, if awarded by a foreign university, that is recognized by a Canadian university or a Canadian professional association; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall not have been convicted, as an adult, within the preceding 10 years, of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated drug offence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated criminal offence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence committed outside Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted an offence referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii).

Subsection.Text: To apply for a dealer’s licence, a person shall submit an application to the Minister containing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is sought for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an individual, the individual’s name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a corporation, the corporation’s name and any other name registered with a province, under which it intends to carry out the activities specified in its dealer’s licence or intends to identify itself; and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder of a position mentioned in paragraph 8.2(c), the applicant’s name and the title of the position;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the address, telephone number and, if applicable, the facsimile number and e-mail address for the premises to which the dealer’s licence would apply and, if different, the mailing address for the premises;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, date of birth and gender of the individual in charge of the premises;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the proposed qualified person in charge and, if applicable, the proposed alternate qualified person in charge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their name, date of birth and gender,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: their academic qualifications, training and work experience relevant to their duties,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: their hours of work at the premises,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: their title at the premises,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and title of their immediate supervisor at the premises, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a pharmacist or a practitioner, the name of the province in which the person’s current professional licence, certification or authorization was issued and the professional licence, certification or authorization number;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name and gender of the individuals authorized to place an order for a narcotic on behalf of the applicant;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the activities referred to in section 8 for which the licence is sought that would be carried out at the premises to which the dealer’s licence would apply;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product or compound that contains a narcotic but is not a test kit and that would be made or assembled for or by the applicant,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name, if any, of each product or compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the narcotic in each product or compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the narcotic in each product or compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity or package sizes of each product or compound, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: if the product or compound would be made or assembled by or for another licensed dealer under a custom order, the name, address and dealer’s licence number of the other licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is sought to produce a narcotic other than a product or compound that contains a narcotic,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the narcotic to be produced,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity that the applicant expects to produce under the dealer’s licence and the period during which that quantity would be produced, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the narcotic would be produced for another licensed dealer under a custom order, the name, address and dealer’s licence number of the other licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the security measures at the premises, determined in accordance with the Security Directive;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the method that the applicant proposes to use for recording their narcotic transactions; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: for any activity referred to in section 8, other than the activities described in paragraphs (g) and (h), the name of the narcotic and the purpose for carrying out the activity.

Subsection.Text: An application for a dealer’s licence must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the individual in charge of the premises to which the licence would apply; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be accompanied by a statement signed by the individual in charge indicating that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of their knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the individual has the authority to bind the applicant.

Subsection.Text: An application for a dealer’s licence must be accompanied by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: declarations signed by the individual in charge of the premises to which the application applies, the proposed qualified person in charge and, if applicable, the proposed alternate qualified person in charge, stating that they have not been convicted, as an adult, during the preceding 10 years, of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated drug offence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated criminal offence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence committed outside Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted an offence referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a document issued by a Canadian police force with respect to each of the persons referred to in paragraph (a), stating whether the person has or has not been convicted, as an adult, during the previous 10 years, of a designated drug offence or a designated criminal offence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if any of the persons referred to in paragraph (a) has ordinarily resided in a country other than Canada during the preceding 10 years, a document issued by a police force of that country stating whether the person has or has not been convicted in that country, as an adult, during the preceding 10 years, of an offence that would have constituted a designated drug offence or a designated criminal offence if committed in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement, signed and dated by the individual in charge of the premises to which the application applies, stating that the proposed qualified person in charge and, if applicable, the proposed alternate qualified person in charge have the knowledge and experience required under paragraph 8.3(2)(a);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the proposed qualified person in charge or, if applicable, the proposed alternate qualified person in charge is not a pharmacist or a practitioner of medicine, dentistry or veterinary medicine registered with a provincial professional licensing authority, a copy of the person’s degree required under subparagraph 8.3(2)(b)(ii) and a copy of the course transcript for that degree;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant’s name appears on the label of a product or compound that contains a narcotic, a copy of the inner label, as defined in section A.01.010 of the Food and Drug Regulations, for each product or compound to which the licence would apply; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant is a corporation, a copy of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the certificate of incorporation or other constituting instrument, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any document filed with the province in which the premises to which the licence would apply are located that states its corporate name or any other name registered with the province, under which the applicant intends to carry out the activities specified in its dealer’s licence or intends to identify itself.

Subsection.Text: The method proposed by the applicant under paragraph (1)(j) must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: allow for the recording of narcotic transactions in accordance with section 15; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: permit the Minister to audit the activities of the licensed dealer with respect to narcotics.

Subsection.Text: The documents referred to in paragraphs (3)(b) and (c) are not required if the persons referred to in those paragraphs consent in writing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to having a criminal record check carried out for them, as an adult, in respect of the offences referred to in those paragraphs during the preceding 10 years;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to provide all necessary information and to submit to any means of identification required to obtain the criminal record check; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to pay the fee established by the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, Criminal Record Verification for Civil Purposes Fee Regulations.

Section.Text: The Minister may, on receiving an application made under these Regulations, require the submission of any additional information that pertains to the information contained in the application and that is necessary for the Minister to process the application.
Subject to section 9.4, the Minister shall, after examining the information and documents required under sections 9 and 9.1, issue a dealer’s licence that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the licensed dealer or the title of the position they hold, or, if the licensed dealer is a corporation, its corporate name;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the activities that are permitted;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the premises at which the licensed dealer may carry on the permitted activities;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the narcotic for which the activities are permitted;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the security level at the premises, determined in accordance with the Security Directive;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the licence, which may not be later than three years after its effective date;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: any conditions to be met by the licensed dealer to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: provide the security level referred to in paragraph (f), or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce the potential security, public health or safety hazard, including the risk of the narcotic being diverted to an illicit market or use;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a producer of a narcotic, the quantity of the narcotic that may be produced under the licence and the period during which that quantity may be produced; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the maker or assembler of a product or compound that contains a narcotic but is not a test kit, an annexed list that sets out the following information for each type of product or compound that may be made or assembled under the licence:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the licence number,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name, if any, of each product or compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the narcotic in each product or compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the narcotic in each product or compound, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity or package sizes of each product or compound.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer may, subject to the terms and conditions of their licence, produce, make, assemble, sell, provide, transport, send or deliver only narcotics specified in their licence.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall refuse to issue, renew or amend a dealer’s licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant is not eligible under section 8.2;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an inspector who has requested an inspection has not been given the opportunity by the applicant to conduct an inspection under section 16;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: false or misleading information or false or falsified documents were submitted in or with the application;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an activity for which the licence is requested would not be in compliance with an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (d.1)
Paragraph.Text: an activity for which the licence is requested is the cultivation, propagation or harvesting of marihuana other than for scientific purposes;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority or the United Nations raises a reasonable belief that the applicant has been involved in the diversion of a narcotic to an illicit market or use or has been involved in an activity that was not in compliance with an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not have in place the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of an activity for which the licence is requested;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant is in contravention of or has contravened during the preceding 10 years,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a provision of the Act or the regulations made or continued under it, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a term or condition of another dealer’s licence or of an import or export permit issued to the applicant under any regulations made or continued under the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the issuance, amendment or renewal of the licence would likely create a risk to public health, safety or security, including the risk of a narcotic being diverted to an illicit market or use;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the individual in charge of the premises, the proposed qualified person in charge or, if applicable, the proposed alternate qualified person in charge has been convicted, as an adult, within the preceding 10 years, of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated drug offence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated criminal offence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence committed outside Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted an offence referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed method referred to in paragraph 9(1)(j) is not capable of recording narcotic transactions as required under section 15 or of permitting the Minister to audit the applicant’s activities with respect to narcotics in a timely manner; or

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the additional information required under section 9.1 has not been provided or is insufficient to process the application.

Subsection.Text: Unless it is necessary to do so to protect public health, safety or security, including preventing a narcotic from being diverted to an illicit market or use, the Minister shall not refuse to issue, renew or amend a licence under paragraph (1)(c) or (g) if the applicant

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act or any regulation made or continued under it; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, these Regulations and the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations;

Subsection.Text: To apply to renew a dealer’s licence, a licensed dealer shall submit to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraphs 9(1)(a) to (k); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the following documents, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the documents referred to in paragraphs 9(3)(a) and (d) and, subject to subsection 9(5), the document referred to in paragraph 9(3)(b),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable and if not previously submitted in respect of the dealer’s licence that is being renewed, the document referred to in paragraph 9(3)(e), and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the original dealer’s licence that is to be renewed.

Subsection.Text: An application for renewal must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the individual in charge of the premises to which the renewed dealer’s licence would apply; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be accompanied by a statement signed by the individual in charge indicating that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of their knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the individual in charge has the authority to bind the applicant.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 9.4, the Minister shall, after examining the information and documents required under subsections (1) and (2) and section 9.1, issue a renewed dealer’s licence that contains the information specified in paragraphs 9.2(a) to (k).
To have its dealer’s licence amended, a licensed dealer shall submit to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an application in writing describing the proposed amendment, accompanied by the supporting documents referred to in section 9 that are relevant to the proposed amendment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the original dealer’s licence.

Subsection.Text: An application for amendment must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the individual in charge of the premises to which the amended dealer’s licence would apply; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be accompanied by a statement signed by the individual in charge indicating that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of their knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the individual in charge has the authority to bind the applicant.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 9.4, the Minister shall, after examining the application for amendment and the supporting documentation, amend the dealer’s licence in accordance with the application and may add any conditions to be met by the licensed dealer to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide the security level referred to in paragraph 9.2(f) or the new level required as a result of the amendment being implemented; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reduce the potential security, public health or safety hazard, including the risk of the narcotic being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: obtain the Minister’s approval before making any of the following changes, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a change relating to the security at the premises referred to in the dealer’s licence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the replacement or addition of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the individual in charge of the premises to which the dealer’s licence applies,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the qualified person in charge and, if applicable, an alternate qualified person in charge at the premises to which the dealer’s licence applies, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: an individual authorized to place an order for a narcotic on behalf of the licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: notify the Minister, not later than 10 days after the change, when a person referred to in clause (a)(ii)(A) or (C) ceases to carry out their duties as specified in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the application for the dealer’s licence under section 9,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the application to renew the dealer’s licence under section 9.5, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the request for approval under paragraph (a); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: notify the Minister, not later than the next business day after the change, when a person referred to in clause (a)(ii)(B) ceases to carry out their duties as specified in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the application for the dealer’s licence under section 9,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the application to renew the dealer’s licence under section 9.5, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the request for approval under paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer shall, with the request for approval referred to in subparagraph (1)(a)(ii), provide the Minister with the following information and documents with respect to the new person:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the replacement of the individual in charge of the premises to which the dealer’s licence applies,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information specified in paragraph 9(1)(c), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the declarations specified in paragraph 9(3)(a) and, subject to subsection 9(5), the documents specified in paragraphs 9(3)(b) and (c);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the replacement of the qualified person in charge or the replacement or addition of the alternate qualified person in charge at the premises to which the dealer’s licence applies,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information specified in paragraph 9(1)(d), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the documents specified in paragraphs 9(3)(a), (d) and (e) and, subject to section 9(5), the documents specified in paragraphs 9(3)(b) and (c); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the replacement or addition of an individual who is authorized to place an order for a narcotic on behalf of the licensed dealer, the individual’s name and gender.

Section.Text: The Minister shall revoke a dealer’s licence at the request of the licensed dealer or on being notified by the licensed dealer that the licence has been lost or stolen.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister shall revoke a dealer’s licence in accordance with section 9.92 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licence was issued on the basis of false or misleading information or false or falsified documents submitted in or with the application;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has failed to comply with a provision of the Act, a regulation under it or a term or condition of the licence or of an import or export permit issued under these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer is no longer eligible under section 8.2; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: it is discovered that the individual in charge of the premises to which the licence applies, the qualified person in charge or, if applicable, the alternate qualified person in charge at those premises has been convicted, as an adult, within the preceding 10 years, of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated drug offence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated criminal offence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence committed outside Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted an offence referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii); or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority or the United Nations raises a reasonable belief that the licensed dealer has been involved in the diversion of a narcotic to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: Unless it is necessary to do so to protect public health, safety or security, including preventing a narcotic from being diverted to an illicit market or use, the Minister shall not revoke a dealer’s licence under paragraph (1)(a) or (b) if the licensed dealer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has no history of non-compliance with the Act and the regulations made or continued under it; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, these Regulations and the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations.

Section.Text: The Minister shall suspend a dealer’s licence without prior notice if it is necessary to do so to protect security, public health or safety, including preventing a narcotic from being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister proposes to refuse to issue, amend or renew, or proposes to revoke, a dealer’s licence under these Regulations, the Minister shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: send a notice to the applicant or to the licensed dealer, together with a written report that sets out the reasons for the proposed refusal or revocation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: give the applicant or the licensed dealer an opportunity to be heard in respect of the proposed refusal or revocation.

Subsection.Text: The suspension of a dealer’s licence under these Regulations takes effect as soon as the Minister notifies the licensed dealer of the decision to suspend and provides a written report that sets out the reasons for the suspension.

A person who receives a notice of suspension referred to in subsection (2) may, within 10 days after receiving the notice, provide the Minister with reasons why the suspension of the licence is unfounded.

Section.Text: The Minister may, upon application therefor, issue a permit to any licensed dealer for the importation or exportation of a narcotic.

Every licence or permit issued under these Regulations is subject to the condition that the licensed dealer will comply with the provisions of these Regulations and the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations.
The Minister shall revoke a permit at the request of the holder or if the holder informs the Minister that the permit has been lost or stolen.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister shall revoke a permit by taking the same measures as those set out in subsection 9.92(1) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any of paragraphs 9.9(1)(a) to (e) applies with respect to the dealer’s licence as it pertains to the narcotic to be imported or exported; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the import or export permit was issued on the basis of false or misleading information or false or falsified documents submitted in support of the application.

Subsection.Text: Unless it is necessary to do so to protect public health, safety or security, including preventing a narcotic from being diverted to an illicit market or use, the Minister shall not revoke a permit under paragraph 9.9(1)(a) or (b), or 13.1(1)(b) if the holder meets the conditions set out in paragraphs 9.9(2)(a) and (b).
The Minister may revoke a permit if the holder

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: fails to comply with the Minister’s decision to suspend the permit under section 13.2; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: fails to rectify the situation giving rise to the suspension within the period referred to in subsection 13.2(3).

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall suspend a permit without prior notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the dealer’s licence as it pertains to the narcotic to be imported or exported has expired or has been suspended or revoked;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is necessary to protect public health, safety or security;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the continuation of the permit would present a risk of a narcotic being diverted to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the import or export would contravene the laws of the country of export or import, or a country of transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: A decision of the Minister to suspend a permit, takes effect as soon as the Minister notifies the holder of the decision and provides a written report of the reasons for the suspension.
A person whose permit is suspended under subsection (1) may, within 10 days after receiving the notice of suspension, provide the Minister with reasons why the suspension is unfounded.
A dealer’s licence is valid until the earlier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date set out in the licence, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the revocation or suspension of the licence under section 9.8, 9.9 or 9.91.

Subsection.Text: A permit issued under section 10 is valid only for the particular importation or exportation in respect of which it was issued.

Section.Text: Every licensed dealer shall keep a record of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of any narcotic received by the licensed dealer, the name and address of the person who sold or provided it and the date on which it was received;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, quantity and form of any narcotic sold or provided by the licensed dealer, the name and address of the person to whom it was sold or provided and the date on which it was sold or provided;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of any narcotic used in the making or assembling of a product or compound containing that narcotic, the name and quantity of the product or compound made or assembled and the date on which the product or compound was placed in stock;

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of any narcotic produced and the date on which it was placed in stock; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of any narcotic in stock at the end of each month.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, in respect of an applicant for a dealer’s licence or a licensed dealer, require an inspection, at any reasonable time, of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the premises used or intended to be used in producing, making, assembling or storing a narcotic; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the process and conditions of the producing, making, assembling or storing.

Section.Text: Every licensed dealer shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: furnish such information respecting the dealings of such person in any narcotic in such form and at such times as the Minister may require;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: produce to an inspector any books, records or documents required to be kept by these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: permit an inspector to make copies of or to take extracts from such books, records and documents; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: permit an inspector to check all stocks of narcotics located on the premises described in the licence of the licensed dealer.

Section.Text: Every licensed dealer shall keep in the premises described in the licence full and complete records respecting any narcotic or transaction therein

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for a period of at least two years; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a manner that will enable an audit to be made at any time of such records.

Section.Text: Every licensed dealer shall notify the Minister promptly of changes in the following:

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the premises in which a narcotic is produced, made, assembled or stored; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the process and conditions of the producing, making, assembling or storing.

Section.Text: Every licensed dealer shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide such protection against loss or theft of any narcotic in his possession as may be required by the Minister; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: report to the Minister any loss or theft of a narcotic within 10 days of his discovery thereof.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer may only import into or export out of Canada a narcotic at the place specified in his permit.
A licensed dealer shall securely pack in a package sealed in such a manner that it cannot be opened without breaking the seal any narcotic intended for export out of Canada.

Subsection.Text: Except as provided in subsection (2), a licensed dealer shall, in taking delivery of a narcotic imported by him or in making delivery of a narcotic,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take such steps as are necessary to ensure safekeeping of the said narcotic during transit; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: use such method of transportation as will ensure an accurate record being kept of the narcotic and of the signatures of any persons having charge of the narcotic until it is delivered to the consignee.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer may deliver a verbal prescription narcotic by common carrier.
No licensed dealer shall sell or provide a narcotic to any person except in accordance with this section and sections 27 and 28.
Subject to section 25, a licensed dealer may sell or provide any narcotic other than diacetylmorphine (heroin) to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: another licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a pharmacist;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a hospital employee or a practitioner in a hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a person exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to the possession of that narcotic; or

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection (2), for greater certainty, a licensed dealer may sell or provide a narcotic to a midwife, nurse practitioner or podiatrist only if the midwife, nurse practitioner or podiatrist is permitted to prescribe or possess the narcotic, or to conduct an activity with it, in accordance with sections 3 and 4 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations.
No licensed dealer shall sell or provide dried marihuana to any person referred to in paragraphs (2)(b) to (d).
Subject to section 25, a licensed dealer may sell or provide diacetylmorphine (heroin) to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: another licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a hospital employee, if that hospital provides care or treatment to persons;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner of medicine or a nurse practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: if practising in a hospital that provides care or treatment to persons, a practitioner of dentistry;

Paragraph.Label: (c.2)
Paragraph.Text: a pharmacist; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a person exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to the possession of that narcotic for a scientific purpose.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer may sell or provide cannabis to a licensed producer.

Section.Text: Subject to sections 26 and 36, no licensed dealer shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sell or provide a narcotic, other than a verbal prescription narcotic, to a pharmacist named in a notice issued by the Minister under paragraph 48(1)(a);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sell or provide a verbal prescription narcotic, other than a preparation mentioned in section 36, to a pharmacist named in a notice issued by the Minister under paragraph 48(1)(b);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sell or provide a preparation mentioned in section 36 to a pharmacist named in a notice issued by the Minister under paragraph 48(1)(c);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: sell or provide a narcotic, other than a verbal prescription narcotic, to a practitioner named in a notice issued by the Minister under subsection 59(1); or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: sell or provide a verbal prescription narcotic to a practitioner named in a notice issued by the Minister under subsection 59(1).

Section.Text: Section 25 does not apply to a licensed dealer to whom the Minister has issued a notice of retraction of the notice

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: under section 49, in respect of a pharmacist named in a notice issued by the Minister under subsection 48(1); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: under section 60, in respect of a practitioner named in a notice issued by the Minister under subsection 59(1).

Subsection.Text: Subject to this section, a licensed dealer may, in accordance with the terms and conditions of their dealer’s licence, sell or provide a narcotic under subsection 24(2), (4) or (5) if the licensed dealer has, on the premises specified in the licence, received

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a written order,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an order sent through a computer from a remote input device, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a verbal order for verbal prescription narcotics

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: that specifies the name and quantity of the narcotic to be supplied.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer who has received an order referred to in paragraph (1)(a) may sell or provide a narcotic under subsection 24(2), (4) or (5) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the order is signed and dated

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the narcotic is to be sold or provided to a person referred to in paragraph 24(2)(a), (b), (c) or (e) or 24(4)(a) or (d) or subsection 24(5), by that person, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the narcotic is to be provided to a hospital employee or a practitioner in a hospital, by the pharmacist in charge of the dispensary of the hospital or by a practitioner authorized by the person in charge of the hospital to sign the order; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the signature of the person referred to in paragraph (a), if unknown to the licensed dealer, has been verified.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer who has received an order referred to in paragraph (1)(b) or (c) may provide a narcotic to a hospital employee or to a practitioner in a hospital if the order has been placed by the pharmacist in charge of the dispensary of the hospital or by a practitioner authorized by the person in charge of the hospital to place the order.

A licensed dealer may sell or provide a narcotic pursuant to an order received from a remote input device through a computer if the computer program and the remote input device meet the requirements of subsections (6) and (7).

A licensed dealer who has received a verbal order referred to in paragraph (1)(c), and has sold or provided a verbal prescription narcotic to a person referred to in paragraph 24(2)(b), (c) or (d), shall immediately record

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person to whom the verbal prescription narcotic was sold or provided;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the verbal prescription narcotic was provided to a hospital employee or a practitioner in a hospital, the name of the person who placed the order; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date the order was received.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, a remote input device shall be a device for transmitting electronically orders for drugs, other than by voice communication, that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: contains a unique identifying code that can be related to the device and the pharmacist or practitioner in whose possession and care the remote input device has been placed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is in the possession and care of that pharmacist or practitioner; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is designed in such a way that the unique identifying code for the remote input device is an integral part of the circuitry and can only be modified by the dismantling of the device.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, a computer program shall be able to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: identify the remote input device, the name and address of the pharmacist or practitioner in whose possession and care the remote input device has been placed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: identify the pharmacist or practitioner placing the order by means of a code unique to that pharmacist or practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: process separately and identify narcotics by the segregation of orders for those narcotics;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: detect unusual orders and thereby necessitate intervention by the licensed dealer; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: necessitate manual intervention by the licensed dealer if one or more of the check procedures fails.

Subsection.Text: Where a licensed dealer has received an order referred to in paragraph (1)(b) from a pharmacist or practitioner, he shall, within five working days after filling the order, obtain and keep a receipt that includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the signature of the pharmacist or practitioner who received the narcotic;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date the pharmacist or practitioner received the narcotic; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of the narcotic.

Subsection.Text: If a licensed dealer has not obtained a receipt from a pharmacist or practitioner under subsection (8) within the time prescribed by that subsection, the licensed dealer shall not, until after obtaining the receipt, sell or provide a narcotic to the pharmacist or practitioner pursuant to any further

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: order sent through a computer from a remote input device referred to in paragraph (1)(b), or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: verbal order referred to in paragraph (1)(c) from that pharmacist or practitioner who placed the order for which no receipt has been received.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer must not sell or provide a narcotic, other than a preparation described in section 36, unless the narcotic is securely packed in its immediate container. The container must be sealed in such a manner that it cannot be opened without breaking the seal.
Section 28 does not apply to a test kit that contains a narcotic where a registration number has been issued for the test kit pursuant to section 6 and has not been cancelled pursuant to section 7.

A pharmacist who receives a narcotic from a licensed dealer or fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil from a licensed producer shall immediately enter the following in a book, register or other record maintained for such purposes:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of the narcotic received;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date the narcotic was received; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the person from whom the narcotic was received.

Subsection.Text: No pharmacist shall sell or provide narcotics except in accordance with this section and sections 34 to 36 and 45.
A pharmacist may sell or provide a narcotic — other than fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil received from a licensed producer — to a person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the person is exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to the possession of that narcotic;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: except in the case of diacetylmorphine (heroin), if the pharmacist has received a written order or prescription for the narcotic that is signed and dated by a practitioner and the signature of the practitioner, if not known to the pharmacist, has been verified by the pharmacist; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of diacetylmorphine (heroin), if the pharmacist has received a written order or prescription for the narcotic that is signed and dated by a practitioner of medicine or a nurse practitioner and the signature of the practitioner, if not known to the pharmacist, has been verified by the pharmacist.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection (2), for greater certainty, a pharmacist may sell or provide a narcotic to a midwife, nurse practitioner or podiatrist only if the midwife, nurse practitioner or podiatrist is permitted to prescribe or possess the narcotic, or to conduct an activity with it, in accordance with sections 3 and 4 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations.
A pharmacist may sell or provide methadone to the following persons, in addition to the persons referred to in subsection (2):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: another pharmacist;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a hospital employee; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner.

Subsection.Text: If authorized by the person in charge of the hospital, a pharmacist practising in a hospital may sell, provide or return fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil received from a licensed producer in accordance with subsection 65(2.1) or (3.1) or section 65.3.

Section.Text: Subject to section 33 and despite subsections 31(2) and (3) and sections 34 to 36, no pharmacist shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sell or provide a narcotic, other than a verbal prescription narcotic, to a pharmacist named in a notice issued by the Minister under paragraph 48(1)(a);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sell or provide a verbal prescription narcotic, other than a preparation mentioned in section 36, to a pharmacist named in a notice issued by the Minister under paragraph 48(1)(b);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sell or provide a preparation mentioned in section 36 to a pharmacist named in a notice issued by the Minister under paragraph 48(1)(c);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: dispense, sell or provide a narcotic, other than a verbal prescription narcotic, to a practitioner or fill a prescription or order for a narcotic, other than a verbal prescription narcotic, from a practitioner, named in a notice issued by the Minister under subsection 59(1); or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: dispense, sell or provide a verbal prescription narcotic to a practitioner or fill a prescription or order for a verbal prescription narcotic from a practitioner, named in a notice issued by the Minister under subsection 59(1).

Section.Text: Section 32 does not apply to a pharmacist to whom the Minister has issued a notice of retraction of the notice

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: under section 49, in respect of a pharmacist named in a notice issued by the Minister under subsection 48(1); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: under section 60, in respect of a practitioner named in a notice issued by the Minister to under subsection 59(1).

Section.Text: Subject to section 39, a pharmacist may dispense a verbal prescription narcotic on receipt of a prescription or verbal order given by a person whom the pharmacist has taken reasonable precautions to determine is a practitioner.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), a pharmacist may provide a narcotic to an employee of a hospital or a practitioner in a hospital if the pharmacist receives a written order for the narcotic signed and dated by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist in charge of the dispensary of the hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: except in the case of diacetylmorphine (heroin), a practitioner who is authorized by the person in charge of the hospital to sign the order; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of diacetylmorphine (heroin), a practitioner of medicine or dentistry or a nurse practitioner who is authorized by the person in charge of the hospital to sign the order.

Subsection.Text: Before providing a narcotic under subsection (1), the pharmacist receiving the order must know the signature on the order or verify it.

Subject to subsection (2), a pharmacist may, without a prescription, sell or provide a preparation containing not more than 8 mg or its equivalent of codeine phosphate per tablet or per unit in other solid form or not more than 20 mg or its equivalent of codeine phosphate per 30 mL in a liquid preparation if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the preparation contains

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: two additional medicinal ingredients other than a narcotic in a quantity of not less than the regular minimum single dose for one such ingredient or one-half the regular minimum single dose for each such ingredient, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: three additional medicinal ingredients other than a narcotic in a quantity of not less than the regular minimum single dose for one such ingredient or one-third the regular minimum single dose for each such ingredient; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: there is legibly and conspicuously printed on the inner label and the outer label, as those terms are defined in section A.01.010 of the Food and Drug Regulations, a caution to the following effect:

Provision.Text: “This preparation contains codeine and should not be administered to children except on the advice of a physician, dentist or nurse practitioner.”

Subsection.Text: No pharmacist shall sell or provide a preparation referred to in subsection (1) if the pharmacist has reasonable grounds to believe that the preparation is to be used for purposes other than recognized medical or dental purposes.

Section.Text: A pharmacist shall not use an order or prescription, written or verbal, to dispense a narcotic after the quantity of the narcotic specified in the order or prescription has been dispensed.

Where, pursuant to a written order or prescription, a pharmacist dispenses a narcotic, other than dextropropoxyphene or a verbal prescription narcotic, the pharmacist shall forthwith enter in a book, register or other record maintained for such purposes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the person named in the order or prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, quantity and form of the narcotic;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, initials and address of the practitioner who issued the order or prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name or initials of the pharmacist who sold or provided the narcotic;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the narcotic was sold or provided; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the order or prescription.

Section.Text: A pharmacist shall, before dispensing a verbal prescription narcotic pursuant to a verbal order or prescription, make a written record thereof, setting forth

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the person named therein;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with the manner in which it is specified in the prescription, the name and quantity of such oral prescription narcotic or the narcotic and the other medicinal ingredients therein;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the directions for use given therewith;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name, initials and address of the practitioner who issued the order or prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name or initials of the pharmacist who dispensed such oral prescription narcotic;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which such oral prescription narcotic was sold or provided; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the order or prescription.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist shall maintain a special narcotic prescription file in which shall be filed in sequence as to date and number all written orders or prescriptions for narcotics dispensed and the written record of all verbal prescription narcotics dispensed pursuant to a verbal order or prescription as provided in section 39.
A pharmacist shall retain in his possession for a period of at least two years any records which he is required to keep by these Regulations.

Section.Text: A pharmacist shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: furnish such information respecting the dealings of the pharmacist in any narcotic in such form and at such times as the Minister may require;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: make available and produce to an inspector upon request his special narcotic prescription file together with any books, records or documents which he is required to keep;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: permit an inspector to make copies of or to take extracts from such files, books, records or documents; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: permit an inspector to check all stocks of narcotics on his premises.

Section.Text: A pharmacist shall report to the Minister any loss or theft of a narcotic within 10 days of his discovery thereof.
A pharmacist shall take all reasonable steps that are necessary to protect narcotics on his premises or under his control against loss or theft.

Subsection.Text: No pharmacist shall prepare a narcotic unless the Minister has approved the formula thereof, and if such narcotic is a preparation described in section 36, has approved the label and the size of the container in which it will be sold.
A pharmacist who prepares a narcotic shall, in addition to all other records required to be kept, keep a record of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the kind and quantity of any narcotic used in the preparation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of the narcotic prepared; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date that the prepared narcotic was placed in stock.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, “prepare” does not include the compounding of a narcotic pursuant to a prescription of a practitioner.
A pharmacist may, on receiving a written order for a narcotic

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: return the narcotic to the licensed dealer who sold or provided it to the pharmacist, if the order is signed and dated by the licensed dealer; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sell or provide to another pharmacist the quantity of the narcotic that is specified in the order as being required for emergency purposes, if the order is signed and dated by the other pharmacist.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist shall, immediately after returning, selling or providing a narcotic under subsection (1) or after receiving a narcotic under paragraph (1)(b) or subsection 65(4), enter the details of the transaction in a book, register or other record maintained for the purpose of recording such transactions.

A pharmacist shall forthwith after removing, transporting or transferring a narcotic from his place of business to any other place of business operated by him notify the Minister setting out the details thereof.

Section.Text: The Minister shall provide in writing any factual information about a pharmacist that has been obtained under the Act, these Regulations or the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations to the provincial professional licensing authority responsible for the registration or authorization of the person to practise their profession

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the province in which the pharmacist is registered or entitled to practise if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the authority submits a written request that states the name and address of the pharmacist, a description of the information being sought and a statement that the information is required for the purpose of assisting a lawful investigation by the authority, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the pharmacist has

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: contravened a rule of conduct established by the authority,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: been found guilty in a court of law of a designated drug offence or of a contravention of these Regulations or the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: contravened a provision of these Regulations or the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a province in which the pharmacist is not registered or entitled to practise, if the authority submits to the Minister

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a written request for information that states

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the name and address of the pharmacist, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a description of the information being sought, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: documentation that shows that the pharmacist has applied to that authority to practise in that province.

Section.Text: A pharmacist may make a written request to the Minister to send to the persons and authorities specified in subsection 48(3) a notice, issued under section 48, advising them of one or more of the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: recipients of the notice must not sell or provide a narcotic, other than a verbal prescription narcotic, to that pharmacist;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: recipients of the notice must not sell or provide a verbal prescription narcotic, other than a preparation mentioned in section 36, to that pharmacist; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the recipients of the notice must not sell or provide a preparation mentioned in section 36 to that pharmacist.

Subsection.Text: In the circumstances described in subsection (2), the Minister must issue a notice to the persons and authorities specified in subsection (3) advising them that licensed dealers, pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies and licensed producers must not sell or provide to the pharmacist named in the notice one or more of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a narcotic, other than a verbal prescription narcotic;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a verbal prescription narcotic, other than a preparation mentioned in section 36; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a preparation mentioned in section 36.

Subsection.Text: The notice must be issued if the pharmacist named in the notice has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: made a request to the Minister in accordance with section 47 to issue the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contravened a rule of conduct established by the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the pharmacist is practising and that provincial professional licensing authority has requested the Minister in writing to issue the notice; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: been found guilty in a court of law of a designated drug offence or of an offence under these Regulations or the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The notice must be issued to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: all licensed dealers;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: all licensed producers;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all pharmacies within the province in which the pharmacist named in the notice is registered and practising;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the pharmacist named in the notice is registered or entitled to practise; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any interested provincial professional licensing authority in another province that has made a request to the Minister to issue the notice.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (5), the Minister may issue the notice described in subsection (1) to the persons and authorities specified in subsection (3), if the Minister, on reasonable grounds, believes that the pharmacist named in the notice

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has contravened any of the provisions of sections 30 to 45 or section 70;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
