Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, self-administered a narcotic, other than a verbal prescription narcotic, contrary to accepted pharmaceutical practice;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, self-administered a verbal prescription narcotic, other than a preparation mentioned in section 36, contrary to accepted pharmaceutical practice;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, provided or administered a narcotic, other than a verbal prescription narcotic, to a person who is a spouse, common-law partner, parent or child of the pharmacist, including a child adopted in fact, contrary to accepted pharmaceutical practice;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, provided or administered a verbal prescription narcotic, other than a preparation mentioned in section 36, to a person who is a spouse, common-law partner, parent or child of the pharmacist, including a child adopted in fact, contrary to accepted pharmaceutical practice; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: is unable to account for the quantity of narcotic for which the pharmacist was responsible under these Regulations or the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations.

Subsection.Text: In the circumstances described in subsection (4), the Minister must not issue the notice referred to in subsection (1) until the Minister has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: consulted with the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the pharmacist to whom the notice relates is registered or entitled to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: given that pharmacist an opportunity to present reasons why the notice should not be issued and considered those reasons; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: considered

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the compliance history of the pharmacist in respect of the Act and the regulations made or continued under it, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the actions of the pharmacist pose a significant security, public health or safety hazard, including the risk of the narcotic being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Text: The Minister must provide the licensed dealers, licensed producers, pharmacies, and provincial professional licensing authorities who were issued a notice under subsection 48(1) with a notice of retraction of that notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the circumstance described in paragraph 48(2)(a), the requirements set out in subparagraphs (b)(i) and (ii) have been met and one year has elapsed since the notice was issued by the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a circumstance described in any of paragraphs 48(2)(b) and (c) and (4)(a) to (f), the pharmacist named in the notice has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: requested in writing that a retraction of the notice be issued, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: provided a letter from the provincial professional licensing authority of the province, in which the pharmacist is registered or entitled to practise, in which the authority consents to the retraction of the notice.

Subsection.Text: No practitioner shall administer a narcotic to a person or animal, or prescribe, sell or provide a narcotic for a person or animal, except as authorized under this section or the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations.

Subject to subsection 53(4), a practitioner may administer a narcotic — other than fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil received from a licensed producer — to a person or animal, or prescribe, sell or provide it for a person or animal, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person or animal is a patient under their professional treatment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the narcotic is required for the condition for which the person or animal is receiving treatment.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner of dentistry or veterinary medicine shall not administer diacetylmorphine (heroin) to an animal or to a person who is not an in-patient or out-patient of a hospital providing care or treatment to persons, and shall not prescribe, sell or provide diacetylmorphine (heroin) for an animal or such a person.
A health care practitioner may administer fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil received from a licensed producer to a person or prescribe or transfer it for a person if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person is a patient under their professional treatment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the substance is required for the condition for which the person is receiving treatment.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner who sells or provides a narcotic — other than fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil received from a licensed producer — to a person for self-administration or for administration to an animal shall, whether or not the practitioner charges for the narcotic, keep a record showing the name and quantity of the narcotic sold or provided, the name and address of the person to whom it was sold or provided and the date on which it was sold or provided, if the quantity of the narcotic exceeds

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: three times the maximum daily dosage recommended by the producer, maker or assembler of the narcotic for that narcotic; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: three times the generally recognized maximum daily therapeutic dosage for the narcotic if the producer, maker or assembler has not recommended a maximum daily dosage

Subsection.Text: The practitioner shall keep the record in a place, form and manner that will permit an inspector readily to examine and obtain information from it.

Section.Text: A practitioner shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: furnish to the Minister any information that the Minister may require respecting

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the use by the practitioner of narcotics received — including the administering, selling or providing of them to a person,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the prescriptions for narcotics issued by the practitioner, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the cannabis medical documents provided by the health care practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: produce to an inspector on request any records that these Regulations require the practitioner to keep;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: permit an inspector to make copies of such records or to take extracts therefrom;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: permit an inspector to check all stocks of narcotics on the practitioner’s premises;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: retain in his possession for at least two years any record that these Regulations require him to keep;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: take adequate steps to protect narcotics in his possession from loss or theft; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: report to the Minister any loss or theft of a narcotic within 10 days of the practitioner’s discovery of the loss or theft.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must provide in writing factual information about a practitioner that has been obtained under the Act, these Regulations, the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations, the former Marihuana for Medical Purposes Regulations or the former Marihuana Medical Access Regulations to the provincial professional licensing authority that is responsible for the registration or authorization of persons to practise the profession

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in a province in which the practitioner is, or was, registered or entitled to practise if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the authority submits to the Minister a written request that sets out the practitioner’s name and address, a description of the information being sought and a statement that the information is required for the purpose of assisting a lawful investigation by the authority, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the practitioner

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: has contravened a rule of conduct established by the authority,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: has been found guilty in a court of law of a designated drug offence or of a contravention of these Regulations, the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations or the former Marihuana for Medical Purposes Regulations, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: has contravened a provision of these Regulations, the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations or the former Marihuana for Medical Purposes Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a province in which the practitioner is not registered or entitled to practise, if the authority submits to the Minister

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a written request that sets out the practitioner’s name and address and a description of the information being sought, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: either

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: documentation that shows that the practitioner has applied to that authority to practise in that province, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: documentation that shows that the authority has reasonable grounds to believe that the practitioner is practising in that province without being authorized to do so.

Subsection.Text: The Minister is authorized to provide, in respect of a practitioner of medicine who made a medical declaration that formed the basis for the issuance of an authorization to possess under the former Marihuana Medical Access Regulations, the following information to the provincial professional licensing authority that is responsible for the registration or authorization of persons to practise medicine in the province identified in the declaration as the province in which the practitioner is authorized to practise:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner’s name and address; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to their authorization to practise medicine.

Section.Text: A practitioner may make a written request to the Minister to send to licensed dealers, licensed producers and pharmacies a notice, issued under section 59, advising them of one or more of the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: recipients of the notice must not sell or provide a narcotic, other than a verbal prescription narcotic, to that practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: recipients of the notice must not sell or provide a verbal prescription narcotic to the practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies must not fill a prescription or order for a narcotic, other than a verbal prescription narcotic, written by that practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies must not fill a prescription or order for a verbal prescription narcotic from that practitioner; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if that practitioner is a health care practitioner, the notified licensed producers must not sell or provide fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil on the basis of a cannabis medical document provided by that practitioner.

Subsection.Text: In the circumstances described in subsection (2), the Minister must issue a notice to the persons and authorities specified in subsection (3) advising them that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: licensed dealers and pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies must not sell or provide to the practitioner named in the notice a narcotic other than a verbal prescription narcotic, a verbal prescription narcotic, or both;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: if the practitioner named in the notice is a health care practitioner, the notified licensed producers must not ship fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil to that practitioner;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pharmacists practising in the notified pharmacies must not fill a prescription or order from the practitioner named in the notice for a narcotic other than a verbal prescription narcotic, a verbal prescription narcotic, or both; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the practitioner named in the notice is a health care practitioner, the notified licensed producers must not sell or provide fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil on the basis of a cannabis medical document provided by that practitioner.

Subsection.Text: The notice must be issued if the practitioner named in the notice has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: made a request to the Minister in accordance with section 58 to issue the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contravened a rule of conduct established by the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the practitioner is practising and that provincial professional licensing authority has requested the Minister in writing to issue the notice; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: been found guilty in a court of law of a designated drug offence or of an offence under these Regulations or the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The notice must be issued to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: all licensed dealers;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: all licensed producers;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all pharmacies within the province in which the practitioner named in the notice is registered and practising;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the practitioner named in the notice is registered or entitled to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any interested provincial professional licensing authority in another province that has made a request to the Minister for the notice; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: all pharmacies in an adjacent province in which a prescription or order from the practitioner named in the notice may be filled.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (5), the Minister may issue the notice described in subsection (1) to the persons and authorities specified in subsection (3), if the Minister, on reasonable grounds, believes that the practitioner named in the notice

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has contravened any of the provisions of section 53, 54 or 55 or paragraphs 70(a) and (b);

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: has performed an activity referred to in section 7 of the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations in regard to a person who is not under their professional treatment;

Paragraph.Label: (a.2)
Paragraph.Text: has contravened section 8 or 9 of those Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, self-administered a narcotic, other than a verbal prescription narcotic, under a self-directed prescription or order or, in the absence of a prescription or order, contrary to accepted medical, dental or veterinary practice;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, self-administered a verbal prescription narcotic under a self-directed prescription or order or, in the absence of a prescription or order, contrary to accepted medical, dental or veterinary practice;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, prescribed, provided or administered a narcotic, other than a verbal prescription narcotic, to a person who is a spouse, common-law partner, parent or child of the practitioner, including a child adopted in fact, contrary to accepted medical, dental or veterinary practice;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: has, on more than one occasion, prescribed, provided or administered a verbal prescription narcotic to a person who is a spouse, common-law partner, parent or child of the practitioner, including a child adopted in fact, contrary to accepted medical, dental or veterinary practice; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: is unable to account for the quantity of narcotic for which the practitioner was responsible under these Regulations or the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations.

Subsection.Text: In the circumstances described in subsection (4), the Minister must not issue the notice referred to in subsection (1) until the Minister has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: consulted with the provincial professional licensing authority of the province in which the practitioner to whom the notice relates is registered or entitled to practise;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: given that practitioner an opportunity to present reasons why the notice should not be issued and considered those reasons; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: considered

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the compliance history of the practitioner in respect of the Act and the regulations made or continued under it, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the actions of the practitioner pose a significant security, public health or safety hazard, including the risk of the narcotic being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: In this section, health care practitioner means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is registered and entitled under the laws of a province to practise medicine in that province; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a nurse practitioner within the meaning of section 1 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations who is permitted to prescribe fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil in the province in which they practise.

Section.Text: The Minister must provide the licensed dealers, licensed producers, pharmacies and provincial professional licensing authorities who were issued a notice under subsection 59(1) with a notice of retraction of that notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the circumstance described in paragraph 59(2)(a), the requirements set out in subparagraphs (b)(i) and (ii) have been met and one year has elapsed since the notice was issued by the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a circumstance described in any of paragraphs 59(2)(b) and (c) and (4)(a) to (f), the practitioner named in the notice has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: requested in writing that a retraction of the notice be issued, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: provided a letter from the provincial professional licensing authority of the province, in which the practitioner is registered or entitled to practise, in which the authority consents to the retraction of the notice.

Section.Text: A person who is in charge of a hospital shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: keep or cause to be kept in a book, register or other record maintained for such purposes,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and quantity of any narcotic received,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person from whom any narcotic was received and the date received,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and quantity of any narcotic used in the making or assembling of a product or compound containing that narcotic,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and quantity of any product or compound that was made or assembled and that contains that narcotic and the date on which the product or compound was made or assembled,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the patient for whom a narcotic, other than dextropropoxyphene or a verbal prescription narcotic, was dispensed;

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the practitioner ordering or prescribing a narcotic, other than dextropropoxyphene or a verbal prescription narcotic;

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date a narcotic, other than dextropropoxyphene or a verbal prescription narcotic was ordered or prescribed and the form and quantity thereof;

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the health care practitioner providing a cannabis medical document, the date on which the document was signed and the daily quantity and period of use specified in it,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: details concerning the return of fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil under paragraph 65.3(a) — namely, the name of the substance, the quantity returned, the name and address of the licensed producer to whom it was returned and the date on which it was returned, and

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: details concerning the sale or provision of fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil for destruction under paragraph 65.3(b) or (c) — namely, the name of the substance, the quantity sold or provided, the name and address of the licensed producer or licensed dealer to whom it was sold or provided and the date on which it was sold or provided;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: maintain the recorded information in such form as to enable an audit to be made from time to time for a period of not less than two years from the making thereof;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: take all necessary steps to protect narcotics in the hospital against loss or theft, and report to the Minister any loss or theft of narcotics within 10 days of his discovery thereof.

Section.Text: A person who is in charge of a hospital shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: furnish such information respecting the use of narcotics therein, in such form and at such times as the Minister may require;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: produce to an inspector any books, records or documents required by these Regulations to be kept;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: permit an inspector to make copies thereof or take extracts from such books, records and documents; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: permit an inspector to check all stocks of narcotics in the hospital.

Subsection.Text: No person in charge of a hospital shall permit a narcotic to be sold, provided or administered except in accordance with this section or section 65.3.

On receipt of a prescription or a written order, signed and dated by a practitioner, the person in charge of a hospital may permit a narcotic — other than fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil received from a licensed producer or diacetylmorphine (heroin) — to be administered to a person or an animal under treatment as an in-patient or out-patient of the hospital, or to be sold or provided for the person or to the person in charge of the animal.

On receipt of a prescription, a written order or a cannabis medical document, signed and dated by a health care practitioner, the person in charge of a hospital may permit fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil received from a licensed producer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to be administered to a person under treatment as an in-patient or out-patient of the hospital or to be sold or provided to that person; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to be sold or provided to an individual who is responsible for that person.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (5.1), the person in charge of a hospital may permit a narcotic — other than fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil received from a licensed producer — to be provided, for emergency purposes, to a hospital employee or practitioner in another hospital on receipt of a written order signed and dated by a pharmacist in the other hospital or a practitioner authorized by the person in charge of the other hospital to sign the order.

Subject to subsection (5.2), the person in charge of a hospital may permit fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil received from a licensed producer to be provided, for emergency purposes, to a hospital employee or health care practitioner in another hospital on receipt of a written order signed and dated by a pharmacist in the other hospital or a health care practitioner authorized by the person in charge of the other hospital to sign the order.

Subject to subsection (5.1), the person in charge of a hospital may permit a narcotic — other than fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil received from a licensed producer — to be sold or provided, for emergency purposes, to a pharmacist on receipt of a written order signed and dated by the pharmacist.

No person in charge of a hospital shall permit a narcotic to be sold or provided under subsection (3) or (4) unless the signature of the pharmacist in the other hospital or of the practitioner authorized by the person in charge of the other hospital to sign an order is known to the person who sells or provides the narcotic or has been verified.

No person in charge of a hospital shall permit fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil to be sold or provided under subsection (3.1) unless the signature of the pharmacist in the other hospital or of the health care practitioner authorized by the person in charge of the other hospital to sign an order is known to the person who sells or provides the substance or has been verified.

A person in charge of a hospital may permit a narcotic to be provided to a person who is exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to the narcotic and who is employed in a research laboratory in the hospital for the purpose of research.

The person in charge of a hospital providing care or treatment to persons may permit diacetylmorphine (heroin) to be sold, provided or administered to a person under treatment as an in-patient or out-patient of the hospital on receipt of a prescription or a written order signed and dated by a practitioner of medicine or dentistry or a nurse practitioner.

The person in charge of a hospital who permits fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil to be sold or provided under subsection 65(2.1) to an out-patient or an individual responsible for that patient shall ensure that, taking into account the dried marihuana equivalency factor determined under section 79 of the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in a 30-day period the total quantity of the substance that is sold or provided to that person does not exceed the equivalent of 30 times the daily quantity referred to in subparagraph 65.2(c)(iii); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the substance that is sold or provided to that person at any one time does not exceed the equivalent of 150 g of dried marihuana.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), 30-day period means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the 30-day period beginning on the day on which a substance is first sold or provided to the out-patient or the individual responsible for that patient; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: every 30-day period after the period referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of applying subsection (2), the first 30-day period begins on the day on which a substance is first sold or provided to the out-patient or the individual responsible for that patient after the day on which that subsection comes into force, even if a substance was previously sold or provided to them.

If the person to whom the substance is sold or provided as described in subsection (1) returns it to the hospital, the person in charge of the hospital may, subject to paragraph (1)(b), permit it to be replaced with an equal quantity of the substance.
The quantity of the substance that is replaced under subsection (4) is to be excluded for the purpose of calculating the total quantity referred to in paragraph (1)(a).

Section.Text: The person in charge of a hospital who permits fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil to be sold or provided under subsection 65(2.1) to an out-patient or an individual responsible for that patient shall ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the substance is sold or provided in the immediate container in which it was sold or provided by a licensed producer to an employee of the hospital referred to in subparagraph 22(4)(a)(ii) of the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the immediate container bears the label required under section 84 of those Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a separate label is affixed to the immediate container that contains the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the given name, surname and profession of the health care practitioner who signed and dated the prescription, written order or cannabis medical document,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the given name and surname of the patient,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the daily quantity of dried marihuana, expressed in grams, that is authorized for the patient, as specified in the prescription, written order or cannabis medical document, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the substance was sold or provided;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the label required under paragraph (c) does not cover any portion of the label referred to in paragraph (b);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the patient is provided with a copy of the current version of the document entitled Consumer Information — Cannabis (Marihuana, marijuana), published by the Department of Health; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the patient is provided with a separate document containing the information referred to in paragraph (c).

Section.Text: The person in charge of a hospital may, on receiving a written order for fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil, permit it to be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: returned to the licensed producer who sold or provided it to them, if the order is signed and dated by the producer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sold or provided, for destruction, to a licensed producer who is authorized to destroy fresh or dried marihuana or cannabis oil that the producer did not produce, sell or provide, if the order is signed and dated by the producer; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sold or provided, for destruction, to a licensed dealer who is authorized to destroy it, if the order is signed and dated by the licensed dealer.

Section.Text: The Minister may, on application for it, issue a licence to any person who, in the opinion of the Minister, is qualified to cultivate, gather or produce opium poppy or cannabis for scientific purposes, on any terms and conditions that the Minister considers necessary.

Subsection.Text: Despite anything in these Regulations, a person may, for the purpose of identification or analysis of a narcotic in their possession, provide or deliver the narcotic to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a practitioner of medicine, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an agent or mandatary of that practitioner where the agent or mandatary is exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to possession of that narcotic.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner of medicine who has received a narcotic pursuant to subsection (3) shall forthwith

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of its identification or analysis, provide or deliver the narcotic to a person exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to the possession of that narcotic for that purpose; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: deliver that narcotic to the Minister.

Subsection.Text: An agent or mandatary of a practitioner of medicine who has received a narcotic under subsection (3) shall immediately provide or deliver the narcotic

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to the practitioner of whom he is the agent or mandatary, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to the Minister.

Subsection.Text: A practitioner of medicine who has received, pursuant to subsection (5), a narcotic from his authorized agent or mandatary shall forthwith

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of its identification or analysis, provide or deliver the narcotic to a person exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to the possession of that narcotic for that purpose; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: deliver that narcotic to the Minister.

Section.Text: Every person who is exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to the possession of a narcotic, other than a person to whom a narcotic has been administered, sold, delivered or provided by a practitioner of medicine exempted under section 56 of the Act from the application of any subsection of section 53 with respect to that narcotic, every practitioner of medicine who has received a narcotic under subsection 68(3) or (5) and every agent or mandatary of a practitioner of medicine who has received a narcotic under subsection 68(3) shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: keep and retain for a period of two years from the date of the making of the record, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the kind, date and quantity of any narcotic purchased or received by him,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person from whom the narcotic was received, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: particulars of the use to which the narcotic was put; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: furnish such information respecting such narcotics as the Minister may require, and shall permit access to the records required to be kept by these Regulations.

Section.Text: No person shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: publish or cause to be published or furnish any advertisement respecting a narcotic unless the symbol “N” is clearly and conspicuously displayed in the upper left-hand quarter thereof or, if the advertisement consists of more than one page, on the first page thereof;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: publish or cause to be published or furnish any advertisement to the general public respecting a narcotic; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: advertise in a pharmacy a preparation referred to in section 36.

Section.Text: Any person who violates any provision of these Regulations is guilty of an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding $500 or to a term of imprisonment not exceeding six months, or to both.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 24(1) of the Act, notification shall be given in writing to the Attorney General by registered mail.
The notice referred to in subsection (1) shall be mailed at least 15 clear days prior to the date the application will be made to the magistrate and shall specify

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the magistrate to whom the application will be made;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the time and place where the application will be heard;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the narcotic or other thing in respect of which the application is being made; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence upon which the applicant intends to rely to establish that he is entitled to possession of the narcotic or other thing referred to in paragraph (c).

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section,

Definition.Text: member means any person who is registered, certified or otherwise licensed by a nursing statutory body for the practice of nursing; (membre)

nursing statutory body means any provincial professional licensing authority that, under the laws of that province, registers, certifies or otherwise licenses a person for the practice of nursing. (organisme régissant la profession d’infirmier)

Subsection.Text: The Minister may communicate to a nursing statutory body any information concerning any member of that body obtained under the Act, these Regulations or the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations.
Subsection (2) does not apply to a nurse practitioner.

Section.Text: Where, pursuant to the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act (Police Enforcement) Regulations, a member of a police force or a person acting under the direction and control of the member is, in respect of the conduct of the member or person, exempt from the application of subsection 4(2) or section 5, 6 or 7 of the Act, the member or person is, in respect of that conduct, exempt from the application of these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: In this section, former Regulations means the Narcotic Control Regulations as they read immediately before the day on which these Regulations come into force.
This section applies to a preparation referred to in section 36 of the former Regulations.

Despite these Regulations, if the main panel of the label of a preparation or any outer container of the preparation displays information in accordance with paragraph 36(1)(b) of the former Regulations, that paragraph continues to apply to the main panel of the label or any outer container during the period of six months after the day on which these Regulations are published in the Canada Gazette, Part II.

Section.Text: For the purpose of paragraph 11(2)(a) of the Statutory Instruments Act, these Regulations apply before they are published in the Canada Gazette.

Subsection.Text: Unless the context requires otherwise, “trade-mark”, “trade-marks”, “Trade-mark”, “Trade-marks”, “trade mark” and “trade marks”, are replaced by “trademark”, “trademarks”, “Trademark” or “Trademarks”, as the case may be, in the English version of any regulation, as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Statutory Instruments Act.
